doc:
Mary Eaton https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mary_Eaton 0 Mary Eaton (January 29, 1901 – October 10, 1948) was a leading American stage actress, singer, and dancer in the 1910s and 1920s. A professional performer since childhood, she enjoyed success in stage productions such as the Ziegfeld Follies and early sound films such as Glorifying the American Girl and The Cocoanuts, but found her career in sharp decline by the mid-1930s. A battle with alcoholism led to her death in 1948 from liver failure. Mary_Eaton ( January_29_,_1901 – October_10_,_1948 ) was a_leading_American_stage_actress , singer , and dancer in the_1910s_and_1920s . A_professional_performer since childhood , she enjoyed success in stage_productions such_as the_Ziegfeld_Follies and early_sound_films such_as Glorifying the_American_Girl and The_Cocoanuts , but found her_career in sharp_decline by the_mid-1930s . A_battle with alcoholism led to her_death in 1948 from liver_failure .
